captions.text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another episode
of Nerdy Nummies!

As many of you know, Halloween is coming up,
and it is my

absolute favorite holiday. And I was thinking
about what we should

make today and I remembered a little bit ago,
I was at VidCon and

I went Downtown Disney and I found these Maleficent
themed Candy Apples.

I Instagrammed a photo of them and I have
got so many requests from you

guys to make these Maleficent apples, for
the Halloween season, so I thought perfect!

Let’s do it! And, the timing couldn’t
be more perfect, because Disney Parks reached

out because they are having a Halloween contest
called: “Haunt Your Disney Side”

Where, you take pictures of Halloween themed
park treats, like the ones that

we are going to be making today. You
send them in and the winner will

win a private party at The Haunted Mansion
and an overnight stay at Spooky

Cinderella’s Castle at Disney World. It’s
pretty cool, like, maybe if you win

you could, like, invite me maybe, that would
be, like, pretty fun.

Alright, so I had to tell you about it, I’ll
give you more details at the

end of the video if you’re interested. I
just thought it was a really fun

contest that I wanted to share, and I’ll
put some links down below if

you would like to go check it out, but let’s
get baking!

Today, we’re gonna make Maleficent themed
Candy Apples!
Let’s get started!

The things that you will need will be: Some
baking spray, 11 ounces of these square

caramel candies, 3 granny smith apples, a
cookie cutter, this one is a mustache

cookie cutter that I found at a baking store,
I’ll put a link down below.

But, you can use anything you want to make
the horns on the apple.

You’ll also need some wooden candy apple
sticks, I really like these ones

because they have a little skewer at one end
and it just makes it easier to

put it into the apple. You also want two trays
with wax paper on top.

For decoration we have vanilla buttercream
frosting that I’ve dyed purple,

and then we’ve got some purple sugar sprinkles,
green candy melts,

black candy melts, and a tray of homemade
Rice Krispies Treats.

These are really easy to make and I’ll put
a link somewhere here or

down below. I’ve made these before in the
past, lots of videos of how to do it.
Alright, let’s put it all together!!!

The first thing that you’re going to do
is wash and dry your apples so

that the caramel will really stick to them.
Plus, you want to do that anyways.

Then you’re going to take these wooden sticks,
and, the pokey side down, you’re going
to put it right in the middle of your apple.

Once you have your apples ready we are going
to prep them to dip in caramel. So, you’re

going to take your sheet with wax paper on
top and spray a little baking spray on top.

Like so, so that they won’t stick. Then,
you’re going to take your bowl of caramels

and put them in a medium sized sauce pan and
then add a tablespoon of water.

And then we’re going to head over to the
stove to heat this up.

On a low heat, stir the caramels until they
have completely melted.

Now we’re going to dip the apples by slowly
turning them all the way around.

Be Careful not to burn your fingers because
the pan is very hot. And once the apple

is completely covered in caramel lift it up
and let the excess caramel drip off into the pan and

place it over on our greased tray. Once you’ve
dipped all of your apples, place them in the fridge
for about 30 minutes to chill.

While our caramel apples are chilling in the
fridge, we are gonna cut out some Rice Krispies Treat

shapes for the little Maleficent horns. So
you’re going to take your cookie cutter,
and you’re just going to

press down, give it a little wiggle, and then
you’re just going to push out the Rice Krispies.

With a whole tray of Rice Krispies Treats you can
make a lot of these shapes, I took my little extras

and I have my little scraps for snacks, but
I’m just going to show you how to do these
to a few of them,
because we only have 3 apples today.

You’re going to cut them, directly in half,
and then cut again, about an inch in.
A little snack!
And there you have it, little horns!

Now you’re going to cut the rest of your
Rice Krispies Treats just like this, and then

we’re going to stick them in the freezer for 10
minutes, to harden.

Now that our caramel apples and our Rice Krispies
horns have chilled, now we are going to assemble

them with our melted chocolate. I took our
black chocolate melts, I put it into a larger glass bowl,

heated it up, and now, we’re going to attach
these horns. So what you do, you’re going

to dip the ends into the chocolate and now you’re
going to bring it over to your apple and
just stick them
right on there, and hold for about 5 seconds.

Now that we’ve got the Rice Krispies horns
stuck onto our apples, it’s time for the
big dip into our bowl of chocolate.

And don’t worry if you’re a little bit
messy, because it takes a little bit of learning,

but it’s pretty easy. You just stick it in, wiggle it side
to side, try not to get any onto the stick
and then flip it over.

Ooooh! They’re starting to look so cool!
Now we’re going to do this to the rest of our apples.

Once you’ve dipped all of you apples in
the black chocolate melts, I let them sit
for about 10 minutes

to allow them to harden. And now, we are going
to heat up our green melted chocolates,

and I just put it in a little squeezey bottle
for more control. These are really inexpensive,

you can find them at the grocery store or
the craft store and they’re very handy for decorating.

Now we’re going to draw Maleficent’s
face, it’s really easy.

You’re basically going to draw on a heart.
Do a little round on this side, go down

and then on this side you do a little heart
and then you’re just going to fill

it in. Then, we’re just going to do that
to the rest of our apples.

This decoration step is totally optional,
you don’t need to do it, but I just wanted to add

a little bit of extra detail. What I did was
I took a little bit of our black melted

chocolates, put it in a squeezey bottle, just
like I did for the green chocolate.

And then drew a line, in-between the green and
the black.

Final decoration step is purple vanilla buttercream
frosting and our purple sugar sprinkles.

As you can see, I’ve already frosted the
two lines on the horns of these apples and decorated

right in the middle. And I’m going to show
you how to do it, over here.

You’re just gonna take a little guy, like
this, and then you’re just going to make

two lines. One is going to be towards the
top, I’ll start here and then, one line
near the base.

Then you’re just going to take some sprinkles,
sprinkle them on top and they will stick to
the frosting. Don’t be afraid to get messy!!!

Then the last thing that you’re going to
do is just put a line all the way across the

top, then come back, and then right down the
middle.
And then make it rain purple sprinkles!
Make it rain! Make it rain! Make it rain!

This is an optional step, but I like to take
little cupcake liners, and I found little

black ones. And what you do is you just take
one, and you push it flat.
“erooo!”

And then you can stick your candy apple right
on top of it, and move it to a serving tray.
Om nom nom nom nom!!!

Ta-da!!! Here are our Maleficent themed candy
apples, thanks you guys for suggesting it!

These were so much fun to make! And if you
guys make these candy apples please send me

photos on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and Instagram,
I just love seeing your baking creations!

I get a big kick out of it. And while you’re
at it, it you want to send your pictures

over to disneysidecontest.com that’s where
they’re having their Halloween contest.

You could win a party at the haunted mansion
and an overnight stay at Cinderella’s Castle

at Disney World. As a side note, you entries
do not have to be baked treats like we did today.

You can do carved pumpkins, costumes, even
DIY home stuff, just get creative with it!

I’m excited because I’m going to be visiting
Disneyland November 6th! So, if you are

in the Southern California area you should
come say hi! I’ll be hanging out in Downtown

Disney and I’ll be going on a bunch of rides.
I think I’m gonna start with Haunted Mansion
because that is my favorite!

I’ll post additional information down below
about the Haunt Your Disney Side contest,

and a special thanks to Disney Parks for teaming
up with me! This was so fun!

If you guys have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know!

Leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Thanks you guys! Bye-bye!
